ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.step

Interface IStepRecorder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StepRecorder

    public interface IStepRecorder
    A step recorder simplifies visualisation change operations at a graph item. The methods in this interface return a reference to a IStepRecorder. Multiple operations could be chained in a single statement.
    Author:
    Patrick Kofmel (kofmp1@bfh.ch)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add()
      Adds the current graph item to the step recorder sequence.
      IStepRecorder app(String comment)
      Appends a comment to the existing newComment.
      IStepRecorder cmt(String comment)
      Sets comment visualization variable to the new value.
      IStepRecorder cmtOk()
      Sets stateCommentEnabled visualization variable to true.
      IStepRecorder dash()
      Sets dashed visualization variable to true.
      IStepRecorder done()
      Sets done helper variable to true.
      IStepRecorder item(IRestrictedGraphItem item)
      Sets a current graph item for recording.
      IStepRecorder notCmt()
      Sets stateCommentEnabled visualization variable to false.
      IStepRecorder notDash()
      Sets dashed visualization variable to false.
      IStepRecorder notDone()
      Sets done helper variable to false.
      IStepRecorder notTag()
      Sets tagged visualization variable to false.
      IStepRecorder notVisib()
      Sets visible visualization variable to false.
      IStepRecorder res(double result)
      Sets result visualization variable to the new value.
      void save()
      Builds a new step with all added graph items since the last save and clears the list of added items.
      IStepRecorder state(ItemState state)
      Sets state visualization variable to the new value.
      IStepRecorder tag()
      Sets tagged visualization variable to true.
      IStepRecorder value(Object value)
      Sets value helper variable to the new value.
      IStepRecorder visib()
      Sets visible visualization variable to true.
